Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with prostate cancer last week. Trying to get second opinion at MD Anderson in Houston. Does anyone have knowledge of surgeons to recommend? My current urologists has recommended open surgery RP. I am assuming that I will have open surgery RP or robotic RP. Many thanks!
Posts.Signature: Age: 49 PSA: 1.8 in 10/2011, 6.4 in 9/2014, 6.8 when tested on 10/2/14 Biopsy performed: 10/8/14 Biopsy results: 7 of 12 cores positive, T2b Gleason: 3+4 = 7 in 4 cores 4+3 = 7 in 2 cores 4+4 = 8 in 1 core
Posts.Title: What doctors are best at MD Anderson

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for the great advice. In the past 48 hours, I have read most of Dr Walsh's book and it was very helpful. There are many options for fighting PC and it can be a bit overwhelming. It is very helpful getting the opinion of you guys who are way ahead of me on the learning curve. I do feel motivated to get moving asap. Thanks again for the advice and encouragement! Outdoors
Posts.Signature: Age: 49 PSA: 1.8 in 10/2011, 6.4 in 9/2014, 6.8 when tested on 10/2/14 Biopsy performed: 10/8/14 Biopsy results: 7 of 12 cores positive, T2b Gleason: 3+4 = 7 in 4 cores 4+3 = 7 in 2 cores 4+4 = 8 in 1 core
